intro: Chamaepericlymenum canadense f. purpurascens, commonly known as the showy white mountain aster, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming in late summer to early fall. Its foliage consists of alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This subspecies is distinguished by its more vibrant floral display compared to the typical form of the species.
